structure.unit: Executive And Administrative Officers Of The Commonwealth

law.catch_line: Issue And Sale Of Bonds Or Notes Of The Department

text.section: Any bond or note issued under this section:
constitutes the corporate obligation of the department;
shall not constitute a debt of the commonwealth within the meaning or application of the constitution of the commonwealth; and
shall be payable solely as to both principal and interest from:
the revenues from a lease to the department, if any;
proceeds of bonds or notes, if any;
investment earnings on the proceeds of bonds or notes; or
other funds available to the department for such purpose.

Any bonds, debt, other securities or other financing issued for the purposes of sections 62 to 73, inclusive, shall not be considered a debt of the commonwealth or any political subdivision thereof state or a pledge of the faith and credit of the state or any political subdivision of the commonwealth.
Nothing in this section shall limit a local government or any authority of the commonwealth to issue bonds for transportation projects.
